meanings.definition: A person who delays or puts off something.
meanings.sent1: The postponers of the meeting caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent2: The postponers of the project deadline were given more time to complete their tasks.
meanings.sent3: The postponers of the party made everyone wait longer for the fun to begin.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the postponer queen, always pushing things off until later.
meanings.sent5: The postponers in the group were often seen as indecisive and unreliable.

meanings.definition: To delay or defer an action or event.
meanings.sent1: Please do not postponers the decision any further.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to postponers the launch due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: He tried to postponers doing his homework, but eventually had to complete it.
meanings.sent4: The storm postponers the outdoor event, forcing everyone to move indoors.
meanings.sent5: She always postponers cleaning her room until it becomes a big mess.
